# Blizzard salary

::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
Use the following visualizations for Question \_\_ through \_\_.
:::


::: {.cell}

:::


In 2020, employees of Blizzard Entertainment circulated a spreadsheet to anonymously share salaries and recent pay increases amidst rising tension in the video game industry over wage disparities and executive compensation. @fig-blizzard-1 and @fig-blizzard-2 contain plots that display the distributions of annual salaries of hourly and salaried Blizzard employees.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Distribution of annual salaries of Blizzard employees, Option 1](exam-1-review-sa_files/figure-html/fig-blizzard-1-1.png){#fig-blizzard-1 width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Distribution of annual salaries of Blizzard employees, Option 2](exam-1-review-sa_files/figure-html/fig-blizzard-2-1.png){#fig-blizzard-2 width=960}
:::
:::


1.  Which of the figures is better for comparing the median annual salaries of hourly and salaried workers.

    a.  @fig-blizzard-1
    b.  @fig-blizzard-2

2.  In one sentence, explain your reasoning for your answer to Question 1.

    ***A shared x-axis makes it easier to compare summary statistics for the variable on the x-axis.***

3.  The name of the data frame used for this analysis is `blizzard_salary` and the variables plotted are `salary_type` (with values `Hourly` and `Salaried`) and `annual_salary`. Suppose your teammate wrote the following code as part of their analysis of the data.


    ::: {.cell}
    
    :::


    They then printed out the results shown below. Unfortunately one of the number got erased from the printout, it's indicated with `_____` below.

    ```         
    # A tibble: 2 Ã— 3
      salary_type mean_annual_salary median_annual_salary
      <chr>                    <dbl>                <dbl>
    1 Hourly                  63003.               54246.
    2 Salaried                90183.               _____
    ```

    Which of the following is the best estimate for that erased value?

    a.  30,000
    b.  50,000
    c.  **80,000 *(It's a value higher than the median for hourly but lower than the mean for salaried)***
    d.  100,000

4.  Which distribution has a higher standard deviation?

    a.  Hourly workers
    b.  **Salaried workers *(There is more variability around the mean compared to the hourly distribution)***
    c.  Roughly the same
    d.  Can't tell from the information given

5.
